page.title: 05BROUGHTON PARISH BUILDING
page.content: BUILT 1907/8. A BRICK AND TILE SINGLE STOREY BUILDING 92 FEET BY 28 FEET SERVES AS A MEETING PLACE. THE FACILITIES IN THE BUILDING INCLUDE FLUSH TOILETS, OPEN COAL FIRE AND KITCHEN WITH PIPED WATER, ELECTRICITY AND CATERING FACILITIES. THE HALL IS MANAGED BY A COMMITTEE OF PARISHIONERS. HIRING FOR A SMALL FEE BYBOY SCOUTS, CUB SCOUTS, BROWNIES, GUIDES AND SCOTTISH DANCING CLUB TAKES PLACE WEEKLY. BROUGHTON W.I. AND CROXTON AND BROUGHTON GARDEN GUILD MEET MONTHLY. WHIST DRIVES HELD FORTNIGHTLY RAISE MONEY TOWARDS THE UPKEEP ALONG WITH PUBLIC DONATIONS FOR MAJOR REPAIRS. MEETINGS ON CHURCH BUSINESS AND LOCAL AND GENERAL ELECTIONS TAKE PRIORITY OVER ANY PREVIOUS BOOKING. OTHER ORGANISATIONS MAKING BOOKINGS ARE NORTH AND SOUTH STAFFS. CARAVAN CLUB, TENNIS CLUB.
